stories.text:
Hi HN, long time lurker with a throwaway here:

I recently quit academia (social sciences) and I plan to transition into a data science career within the next year or so. This is the part I liked about my academic job and the stuff I am good at (statistics, analytical problem solver, data wrangling/modeling).

Reading through job ads the technical skill palette for DS seems overwhelming: python (+pandas, scikit, ...), R, docker, k8s, PowerBI, Tableau, PostgreSQL, DevOps/pipelines, different cloud providers, maybe add some javascript, various ML toolkits (Tensorflow, etc.).

I have 15 years of experience as a statistician (R/STATA/Linux/SQL) and a sabbatical year in front of me, which new skill(s) should I learn/prioritize?

Thanks!
stories.title: Ask HN: Which new skills for a data science career?
Relationship extraction for knowledge graph creation from biomedical literature

stories.text:
Hey there!

We are building "Burnout Assessment Tool for Remote Teams". Launch on Product Hunt is in 1 month and we need you help!

We are looking for 10 user interviews to validate assessment quality and value of recommendations.

Ideally â€” C-level / Team Leads / Product Managers from remote companies under 200 people.

No shady sales. Just 30 minutes interview. I will send you our 20-pages guide "How to manage stressed employees" after it.

Drop me a sign if you are interested
stories.title: Ask HN: What is your Burnout level lately?
Bike by Hog Bay, a text editor outliner
Netflix Tumbles as 200k Users Exit for First Drop in Decade
Why Bike Club NFT Ditched NFTs
